title: Snap stock gets a boost after Morgan Stanley ends bearish call
text: Morgan Stanley analyst Brian Nowak ended his bearish call on Snap Inc.'s stock SNAP, -3.38% Friday, upgrading the shares to equal-weight from underweight on signs of improvement in the company's advertising products and go-to-market strategy. "At a high level, year-to-date we have underestimated Snap's stronger top- and bottom-line execution and ability to drive growth and upward revisions," Nowak wrote, as Snap's stock has risen 160% in 2019. His conversations with industry players and ad agencies suggest that Snap's new products are making markers more knowledgeable about how to place spots on Snap's platform. He also sees room for the company to improve its monetization, with Snap's average revenue per user currently languishing at a fifth of what Twitter Inc. TWTR, +0.76% brings in and at 1/14th of what Facebook Inc. FB, +2.74% can generate. Nowak boosted his target price to $17 from $14. Snap's stock took a fall in Thursday trading after Facebook's Instagram announced Threads, a new camera app for users' close friends. Shares are off 10% over the past month, while the S&P 500 SPX, +0.80% has lost 0.9%.
